title:
A note on the frequency gaps between integers in the thin obstacle
  problem
abstract:
We give a simple proof of the fact that - in all dimensions - there are no
homogeneous solutions to the thin obstacle problem with frequency $\lambda$
belonging to intervals of the form $(2k,2k+1)$, $k \in \mathbb{N}$. In
particular, there are no frequencies in the interval $(2,3)$.
